TopicTitle: Does anyone actually know what RCS stands for?

Articles.Content: i'm curious, anyone know?
Reaction Control System.
Reaction Control System.

Reaction Control System

 

Reactive Cheese Sandwich
Really Consternating Shuttlecocks
I was just going to be a troll and say "Yes, most of us here do," but a few people who actually wanted to be helpful beat me to the punch.

In spaceflight context, it usually means Reaction Control System. I'm pretty sure the forum software will clarify it for you, along with other acronyms.

Let's see... RCS. Yes, it works. When you see an abbreviation with double dotted underlines you can just mouse over it for the full word, courtesy of the KSP forums.

Edited September 10, 2016 by RocketSquid
For the gemini program it was 'Reentry Control System'.
What all the people above me said.
Really Cool Stuff.
Idk, but I think it has something to do with RCs.... But, what the people above me said.
I love this board... not one LMGTFY link

27 minutes ago, fourfa said:

I love this board... not one LMGTFY link

http://bfy.tw/7d7i
Retrofuturistic Carrot Synthesizer.

RCS = Royal College of Surgeons

 

(but then I do study medicine in the uk so...)

 

(I actually hate hate acronyms cause every specialty, every field of study, every aspect of life has their own acronyms which often over lap! A bad one seems to be AAA,  either a car recovery service or an abdominal aortic anneurism, depending on your point of view and don't get them mixed up! This sort of stuff has led to people being injured so never criticise someone for asking what an acronym means (not that ksp forumers are! ) ) 

Edited September 10, 2016 by Kertech
Also, American Anthropological Association!

For my Kerbals, it has two definitions: Reaction Control System and Rocket Crashing System. To most people, it's Reaction Control System. 

24 minutes ago, Kertech said:

I actually hate hate acronyms cause every specialty, every field of study, every aspect of life has their own acronyms which often over lap! A bad one seems to be AAA,  either a car recovery service or an abdominal aortic anneurism, depending on your point of view and don't get them mixed up! This sort of stuff has led to people being injured so never criticise someone for asking what an acronym means.

Me too! Except there's a fine line between love and hate, right? Actually, today in Language Arts, my teacher asked us what a PMA was. He called on me and I said that the Pressurized Mating Adapter were a docking adapters on the International Space Station. He just said that it was great that I knew two meanings of it, but in LA it ment Positive Mental Attitude.  

Oh well. I may play to much KSP... Except that you can never play too much KSP. Also, my science teacher said never use the word "sucks" we're supposed use "vacuum cleaners," but I use "outer space" instead. It's not possible to play to much KSP...

i'm curious, anyone know?

Reaction control systems.
Retro Cactus System
Round Cabbage Syndrome
The beautiful world of aerospace, where abbreviations are abbreviated.

a car recovery service

The AA (Automotive Association IIRC) is only 2 "A"s.

Also, don't forget batteries!

He called on me and I said that the Pressurized Mating Adapter were a docking adapters on the International Space Station. 8 hours ago, Kozak said:

Does anyone actually know what RCS stands for?

3 letters is a Really Convenient Size for the label on control panel.

5 hours ago, max_creative said:

today in Language Arts, my teacher asked us what a PMA was. He called on me and I said that the Pressurized Mating Adapter were a docking adapters on the International Space Station. He just said that it was great that I knew two meanings of it, but in LA it ment Positive Mental Attitude.

I guess that's good. In Los Angeles you need to keep a Positive Mental Attitude!

On a more serious note, my company got bought out by a much larger company about a year ago, and everything is an acronym. TLA's everywhere, and not one of them is ever defined. I have taken to - when I come across a likely definition because someone slipped up and didn't use the acronym - slowly built up a list. But there are still now, a year later, things I use on a daily basis that I don't know what the acronym actually stands for.

So I feel for you, OP. Though the forum underlining acronyms is a boon. I wish my company did that.
